body_content.explanation: in a running race, to run faster than someone else at the end of the race:
examples: She was in fourth place at the beginning of the straight but outkicked everyone to win.
He likes to stay in the pack and then outkick the rest on the last lap.

body_content.explanation: in sports such as rugby and American football, to kick better than the other team or than another player:
examples: In the battle of the kickers, Rawls outkicked Daniels 2-1 in the first half.
Despite his reputation and experience, he was outkicked by the youngster.
